data.title: source] 2023 Best Video Transcoders for Windows and Mac
data.meta_description: Updated list of 2023 Best video transcoders, including best free and open-source video transcoder software for Windows and Mac that is able to transcode videos from/to MP4, H.264, H.265, and more easily.
data.text:
HandBrake

OS: Windows, Mac and Linux

Handbrake is a popular free and open-source video transcoder which is best to convert videos into MP4 and MKV. It uses a variety of video encoders to freely transcode videos to H.265, H.264, H.265 MPEG-4 and MPEG-2, VP8, VP9, and Theora. There are built-in presets for a couple of devices like iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, Android, etc.

Pros

HandBrake is able to convert VIDEO_TS folders and rip unprotected DVDs to MP4/MKV.

HandBrake comes with multiple setting options.

Handbrake supports H.265/H.264 hardware-accelerated transcoding using QuickSync.

Cons

The output container formats are very limited.

It is complicated to set some setting options.

FFmpeg

OS: Windows, Mac and Linux

FFmpeg is free and open-source video transcoding software that uses command lines to handle videos. It's able to do pretty much everything video-related, including decoding, encoding, transcoding, muxing, demuxing, streaming, filtering and playing. It supports a wide range of encoders and decoders to help convert videos to any format you need (see FFmepg codecs).

Pros

Excellent support for codecs and filters.

Supports almost all the video and audio formats.

Hardware-accelerated encoding and decoding supported.

It supports videos, audios, subtitles, and images.

Cons

It requires steep learning curve.

VLC

OS: Windows, Mac and Linux

VLC media player includes a video transcoding and streaming wizard. You can easily use VLC to transcode videos into H.264, VP80, H.265, MPEG-2, WMV, DIV3, MPEG-4, iPod, DivX, Android, YouTube, and several more. It's the best free video transcoder for those who just want to convert a couple of videos. It's not a good idea to use it to transcode large-size or HD/4K videos as it may take quite a long time.

Pros

It's easy and handy to use.

Convert video/audio, sync subtitles, filter video/audio and apply other effects.

Hardware-accelerated decoding is supported.

Cons

Poor support for videos in 4K or higher resolutions.

Limited video codecs and formats available.

No options to edit or control videos.

Avidemux

OS: Windows, Mac and Linux

Avidemux is a free and open-source software for non-linear video editing and transcoding multimedia files. You can use it to transcode videos from most files to AVI, FLV, MKV, MP4, HEVC H.265, H.264, VOB, and more. The best part is, it's able to encode videos to DVD. The main difference betwen Avidemux and other video transcoding freeware is that Avidemux lets you edit the video and then encode it.

Pros

It's easy and fast to use.

Edit features like split, merge, crop, shift, filters, denoise, resize, etc.

Convert videos to DVD.

Cons

The GUI is quite basic and hard to understand.

Limited video codecs and formats available.

MediaCoder

OS: Windows 10, 8, 7, and earlier

MediaCoder is a free video transcoding software that will convert among most audio and video formats. A wide range of video/audio codecs supported. There are built-in profiles for popular devices, online websites, and broadcast services. It's another free video transcoder that is able to rip physical discs. It's useful to direct capture from camera, input from streaming and storage media.

Pros

H/264/H.265 GPU accelerated encoding using QuickSync, Nvenc, and Cuda.

Ability to rip BD/DVD/VCD/CD.

Rich set of transcoding settings and various filters.

Fast speed and good quality.

Cons

Its interface is outdated and intimidating.

Additional features are available in the premium edition.

Xmedia Recode

OS: Windows 10, 8, 7, and earlier

MediaCoder is a free and open-source video transcoder for Windows 10 that is able to convert almost all audio and video formats. It supports a wide range of video formats including H.264, H.265, MKV, MP4, MOV, FLV, WMV, SWF, QT, MP3, and more. It also accepts DVDs that are not DRM-protected. It's one of the best video transcoding software for fast and simple video reformatting.

Pros

Have all the filters that Handbrake has, including deinterlace, stablize, rotate, crop, pad, and more.

Support non-protected DVDs.

Tons of hardware specific presets.

Cons

The video transcoding speed can be slow compared with other tools.

Convert.Files

In addition to free and open-source video transcoding software for Windows and macOS, there are tons of online video transcoders. Here we also recommend you the site Convert.Files. It supports more than 300 video formats for free.

Pros

No need to install files to local drive and no memory capacity is occupied.

It can also convert videos, audio formats, images, documents, etc.
